sect2.title: Introduction to GOK
sect2.para: GOK is a dynamic onscreen keyboard. It features Direct Selection, Dwell Selection, Automatic Scanning and Inverse Scanning access methods and includes word completion.

sect2.title: Installation of GOK
sect2.para: Install GOK by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=`pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0` \ --sysconfdir=/etc/gnome --localstatedir=/var/lib && make && make install && chmod 644 `pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0`\ /share/gnome/help/gok/C/*.xml

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --sysconfdir=/etc/gnome: This switch puts configuration files in /etc/gnome instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/etc.
--localstatedir=/var/lib: This switch puts ScrollKeeper files in /var/lib/scrollkeeper instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/var/scrollkeeper.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: It is recommended that you configure your input device as an Extended input device. Exact configuration methods depend on the type of hardware attached to your system. See the README file in the package source tree and GOK Help for information on how to configure your input device.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The GOK package contains gok and create-branching-keyboard.

sect3.para: gok is a dynamic onscreen keyboard utility.
